He further said that he is terrified for him and for Ukraine amid the Russian invasion. Sean had earlier shared a picture of escaping Ukraine on foot. "This is an extraordinary moment. The way he has unified that country," the actor added.

349.title: Peaceful polls in Uttar Pradesh surprised Opposition: CM Yogi
349.article_body: Uttar Pradesh Chief Minister Yogi Adityanath on Saturday said the peaceful conduct of six phases of UP Assembly elections has been a surprise for the Opposition. Yogi said that maintaining law and order in UP has been the biggest achievement of BJP government. Notably, campaigning for the seventh and final phase of UP polls came to an end on Saturday.

350.title: Rohit sends Kohli back, asks him to re-enter field for guard of honour, video goes viral
350.article_body: A video has gone viral showing India captain Rohit Sharma sending Virat Kohli back and asking him to re-enter the field before giving him a guard of honour during second day of first Test against Sri Lanka. Kohli was given the guard of honour by his teammates to mark his 100th Test. Kohli scored 45 runs in the first innings.

351.title: Woman declared dead by doctors found alive just before post-mortem in MP
351.article_body: A 32-year-old woman, who was declared dead by doctors, was found alive, just before her post-mortem in Madhya Pradesh. The woman's brother reportedly saw movement in her body and later informed doctors, following which she was found alive and admitted to the hospital. The doctors had also issued a death certificate of the woman, who got injured in an accident.

352.title: I was bullied online, caused me grief: Dua Lipa on viral hip step
352.article_body: Singer Dua Lipa has revealed that she was bullied online for her viral dance step in 2017, saying, "It actually caused me a lot of grief." The step was of her moving her hips back and forth standing virtually still. "The reason we're talking about it is because I've brought it back, I'm doing it on my tour," Dua added.

353.title: 18-yr-old Alcaraz youngest to represent Spain in Davis Cup since Nadal in 2004
353.article_body: Carlos Alcaraz on Friday became the youngest player to represent Spain at the Davis Cup since world number four Rafael Nadal in 2004. Alcaraz, 18, beat Marius Copil in straight sets to win his Davis Cup debut match to give Spain a 2-0 lead over Romania in their qualifying match. Nadal was 17 when he made his Davis Cup debut.

354.title: Difficult to put any blame on his shoulders: Schmeichel on Ronaldo
354.article_body: Former Manchester United goalkeeper Peter Schmeichel said that he feels Cristiano Ronaldo's teammates are to blame for his poor form at Manchester United. "He's trying and trying to build up the other players. When you're at the games...you can see how much he's trying to help everyone," he said. Ronaldo has scored once in his last ten games.

355.title: Towing of vehicles in Mumbai to stop on trial basis: Police chief
355.article_body: Mumbai Police Commissioner Sanjay Pandey on Saturday took to Twitter to seek citizens' opinions on ending vehicle towing practice by traffic police. He wrote, "As a first, we plan to stop towing of vehicles. Experimental to start with...final if you comply. Let me know what you think." He further added that the discussion doesn't reflect official position on the issue.

356.title: India lost nearly 20% species in 20 years: Zoological Survey head
356.article_body: Zoological Survey of India Director Dhriti Banerjee on Thursday said around one-fifth of species in an earmarked geographical location in the country have vanished in last 20 years. Banerjee added upto 150 species a day and 18,000 to 55,000 species a year get extinct worldwide due to human activities. Meanwhile, ZSI recently flagged several fish and turtle species as endangered.

357.title: Box of human heads stolen from medical truck in US
357.article_body: A box of human heads and a dolly have been stolen from a medical truck in US' Denver, according to authorities. Police said the incident took place on Thursday, when someone broke into the truck which was carrying human remains for use in medical research. While no arrest has been made yet, investigation in the case is underway.

358.title: War with Ukraine to have consequences for whole world including Russia-India ties: Russia
358.article_body: Russian Ambassador to India Denis Alipov has said, "Russia-Ukraine crisis will have consequences for the whole world, including Russia-India ties. To what extent, it'll be reflected, can't say now." "There may be an impact in terms of transactions, possibility of financial cooperation in connection with sanctions," he added. This comes as US and many other countries imposed sanctions on Russia.

359.title: Ratan Tata always keeps his promises: 28-yr-old assistant lists 2 of Tata's values
359.article_body: Shantanu Naidu, the 28-year-old assistant of Tata Sons Chairman Emeritus Ratan Tata, in an interview revealed two values that he had observed in the latter. Naidu said, "He will just help so many people each day and then totally forget about it." He added that Ratan Tata always keeps his promises and "always delivers when he has given his word."

360.title: Dating Kanye was 'a crash course on how to be famous': Julia Fox
360.article_body: Actress Julia Fox has stated that her relationship with rapper Kanye West was like "a crash course on how to be famous". She further said that it felt like she was being cast in the role of his girlfriend and Kanye was casting her. "He was the orchestrator of it all. It really did feel like a movie," Julia added.

361.title: Countries imposing no-fly zone over Ukraine would be parties to conflict: Putin
361.article_body: Russian President Vladimir Putin said on Saturday that any country that sought to impose no-fly zone over Ukraine would be considered by Moscow to have entered an armed conflict. He added that it would have "colossal and catastrophic consequences not only for Europe but also the whole world". Putin also dismissed rumours that Russia is planning to declare martial law.

362.title: We're too big to be isolated: Russia on sanctions over Ukraine war
362.article_body: Kremlin spokesman Dmitry Peskov on Saturday termed western nations' sanctions on Russia "economic banditry", adding, "This does not mean Russia is isolated." He added, "The world is too big for Europe and America to isolate a country and even more so a country as big as Russia." He said that US' sanctions on Russia's energy exports would jolt energy markets.

363.title: Australia's King taps armband after taking wicket in Women's WC, pays tribute to Warne
363.article_body: Australia leg-spinner Alana King clean bowled England's Sophia Dunkley in their 2022 Women's World Cup match with a sharp turning delivery and then paid tribute to Australian spin legend Shane Warne by tapping her black armband. Australia's players were wearing two black armbands each in honour of Rod Marsh and Shane Warne, who both passed away this week.

364.title: Nearly 10,000 Russian soldiers killed in 10 days: Ukraine
364.article_body: Ukrainian Foreign Ministry on Saturday claimed nearly 10,000 Russian soldiers have been killed since Russia invaded Ukraine on February 24. The ministry added 269 tanks, 39 aircraft and 40 helicopters were destroyed including the Sukhoi Su-25 attack aircraft. Out of the 10,000 killed troops, over 5,400 were killed till March 2, reported the ministry.

365.title: Warne's ex-fiancée Elizabeth Hurley shares pics with him, says 'RIP beloved Lionheart'
365.article_body: Late Australian cricketer Shane Warne's ex-fiancée, British actress Elizabeth Hurley took to social media to mourn his demise. Sharing pictures with him, she wrote, "I feel like the sun has gone behind a cloud forever. RIP my beloved Lionheart." They got engaged in 2011 and split in 2013, but remained friends.

366.title: Kanye shares post on divorce after legal separation from Kim
366.article_body: Rapper Kanye West took to Instagram to share a post which compares divorce to getting 'full-blown COVID-19', 'being set on fire' and 'walking on glass' among other things. This comes after a court in Los Angeles declared his ex-wife Kim Kardashian legally single and she dropped the surname 'West' from her name on all social media platforms.

367.title: SpaceX launches 47 Starlink satellites in its 9th launch this year
367.article_body: Elon Musk's private space venture, SpaceX launched 47 Starlink satellites on Thursday as part of its ninth launch this year. The newly-launched satellites have joined over 2,000 others, all deployed to create first-generation constellation orbiting Earth. As per SpaceX, the constellation will act as a space-based broadband internet service aimed at providing internet connectivity across the globe.

368.title: Indian artist creates sand art asking to stop Russia-Ukraine war; pic viral
368.article_body: Indian sand artist Sudarsan Pattnaik has appealed for peace through his sand art amid the ongoing Russia-Ukraine war. The art shows Russian President Vladimir Putin and Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskyy in the backdrop of their respective flags with the text "STOP WAR". The middle section shows a child standing on burning ashes with both arms stretched out on either side.

369.title: China announces military drills in South China Sea near Vietnam coast
369.article_body: Chinese government announced military exercises starting from Friday till March 15 in South China Sea in an area between China's Hainan province and Vietnam's Hue. While China claims a large part of the area and has built artificial islands and airfields there, Vietnam had accused China of infringement on its sovereignty as a part of waterway lies within its control.

370.title: Actor Mahesh Babu launches foundation to help kids at Hyd hospital
370.article_body: Telugu actor Mahesh Babu visited Hyderabad's Rainbow Children's Heart Institute on Saturday to launch Pure Little Hearts Foundation. As part of the initiative, the Mahesh Babu Foundation will help treat economically-challenged children with congenital heart diseases. "Children have always been close to my heart...I'm happy to support children who need cardiac care at RCHI," the actor said.

371.title: Towing of vehicles in Mumbai to stop on trial basis: Police chief
371.article_body: Mumbai Police Commissioner Sanjay Pandey on Saturday took to Twitter to seek citizens' opinions on ending vehicle towing practice by traffic police. He wrote, "As a first, we plan to stop towing of vehicles. Experimental to start with...final if you comply. Let me know what you think." He further added that the discussion doesn't reflect official position on the issue.

372.title: Sikkim govt to provide ₹20,000 each to all non-working mothers: CM
372.article_body: Sikkim CM PS Tamang on Friday said that the state government will give ₹20,000 each to all non-working mothers annually under 'Aama' scheme. Only those whose names are in the electoral roll will get the money, he added. The government will also provide free sanitary napkins to girls studying in Class 9 and above under 'Bahini' scheme, he further said.

373.title: UP man kills mother after his share of money given to sister-in-law
373.article_body: Police have arrested a man for allegedly killing his mother and injuring his father in Uttar Pradesh's Bulandshahr. During an investigation, the accused reportedly revealed that his father had sold an ancestral land for ₹12 lakh and distributed the money among his brothers. However, his father gave his share of money to his sister-in-law, following which he killed his mother.

374.title: Biggest advice I got from Elon on crypto is 'be cautious': Musk's brother
374.article_body: World's richest person Elon Musk's brother Kimbal Musk told Input Magazine the biggest advice he got from Elon regarding cryptocurrencies is "be cautious". Kimbal said he doesn't even know what the Tesla CEO's views are on cryptocurrencies. Kimbal earlier said Tesla was ignorant of the environmental impact of cryptocurrencies when it purchased Bitcoin and started accepting it for car purchases.

375.title: Man wanted in 22 cyber fraud cases arrested by Hyd Police in Bihar
375.article_body: A 37-year-old man, involved in 22 cyber fraud cases in Telangana, was arrested in Bihar by Hyderabad Police on Friday. The accused, Rajesh Mahato, offered gifts and lotteries through e-commerce portals before collecting money for claiming them, police said. One of the victims, a woman from Tirumalgiri, was duped of ₹28 lakh by Mahato and his accomplices, police added.

376.title: Video shows Indian students collecting and melting snow for water in Ukraine
376.article_body: A video showing Indian students stuck in Ukraine's Sumy collecting and melting snow for basic water needs has surfaced online. In the video, a student tells that they have to walk for around 2km amid shelling to get drinking water. In another clip, a group of students tell that they don't even have drinking water available with them.

377.title: Ukrainian woman married to Indian man seeks PM Modi's help, says 'My family is there'
377.article_body: Amid tensions between Ukraine and Russia, a Ukrainian woman who is married to a Kashmiri man has reached out to PM Narendra Modi to help Ukraine "in any which way possible". "My heart cries because my family is there...They're peaceful people," said Oliza. "Today, our country is fighting for democracy and peace. They have independence in their heart," she added.

378.title: Man cheats victim of ₹1 lakh at ATM kiosk in Hyderabad, arrested
378.article_body: Hyderabad Police on Friday arrested a 28-year-old man for allegedly defrauding a man who came to deposit money at an ATM kiosk. The accused, Rama Rao, convinced the victim to lend him ₹1 lakh cash saying he'd return it, police said. The victim had also received a message indicating money transfer to his account, but later realised he was duped.

379.title: Hundreds book Airbnbs in Ukraine to send money to citizens amid war
379.article_body: Hundreds of people are booking Airbnb rentals in Ukraine to offer monetary assistance to local families affected by war. This came after US-based influencer Tommy Marcus proposed the idea of paying for Ukrainian Airbnbs to financially support their hosts. Marcus shared some replies from Ukrainian hosts, one of which said, "Hope we'll win and stop this horror."

380.title: I'm not getting what I want on TV: Comedian Ali Asgar
380.article_body: Comedian-actor Ali Asgar in an interview has stated that he is not getting the kind of offers on television like he wants, adding that he said no to a few cameos. "When a show gets shut, the actors are blamed...Then the tag of hit and flop gets attached to you," he added. Ali further said that he wants to reinvent.

381.title: Charlize was finest lead: Tom after she criticised his 'bad behaviour'
381.article_body: Actor Tom Hardy has said that his 'Mad Max: Fury Road' co-star Charlize Theron laid down the finest lead character in an action movie and that credit is much deserved. This comes after Charlize criticised him saying she doesn't want to "make excuses for bad behaviour" but it was a tough shoot, adding that things "came to blows" between them.

382.title: Over 3 crore in 15-18 age group fully vaccinated: Health Minister
382.article_body: Union Health Minister Mansukh Mandaviya on Saturday said that more than three crore youngsters between the ages of 15 and 18 have been fully vaccinated against COVID-19. "Young India is taking the world's largest vaccination drive to the next level!" he added. The vaccination drive for the age group had started on January 3.

383.title: Over 300 cyclists participate in Cyclothon event in Navi Mumbai
383.article_body: Over 300 cyclists participated in 'Cyclothon 2022' held at Navi Mumbai's Palm Beach Road on Saturday. The event was jointly organised by the Navi Mumbai Municipal Corporation and Cyclist Club of India to create awareness about environmental conservation. Several record-holders like Sai Patil, the youngest cyclist to cross the distance from Kashmir to Kanyakumari, were present at the event.

384.title: 9-yr-old UP girl returns home bleeding, says school principal raped her
384.article_body: A nine-year-old girl was allegedly raped by her 71-year-old school principal on Wednesday in Uttar Pradesh's Muzaffarnagar district. The incident came to light when the girl, who's a student of Class 3, returned home bleeding and narrated her ordeal to her parents, a report stated. Meanwhile, police have arrested the principal and a teacher for hiding details of the crime.

385.title: Govt yet to submit emissions targets 4 months after 'net-zero' vow
385.article_body: Centre has not yet submitted its targets for cutting greenhouse gas emissions, four months after PM Narendra Modi announced India would stop greenhouse emissions by 2070. "We don't have time anymore" to wait for all.. to start reducing emissions, said Niklas Höhne, a scientist tracking emission pledges. He urged government to come up with specified targets achievable with country's resources.

386.title: Fashion brands H&M, Zara & Mango shut outlets in Russia over invasion of Ukraine
386.article_body: Zara owner, Inditex has announced that it will close its shops in Russia and also halt online sales over the country’s invasion of Ukraine. Inditex has 502 stores in Russia, of which 86 are Zara outlets. This comes after fashion retailers Mango and H&M also closed their respective shops in Russia owing to the same reason.

387.title: Rohit offers India's Got Talent contestants to compose Cirkus theme
387.article_body: Filmmaker Rohit Shetty, who appeared as a guest judge on 'India's Got Talent', offered contestants Divyansh and Manuraj an offer to compose the theme of his upcoming film 'Cirkus'. Rohit added that rapper Badshah, who is a judge on the show, has composed some of the songs for the film. The filmmaker also urged Badshah to work with the duo.

388.title: Pune Metro work incomplete but PM will inaugurate it: NCP chief
388.article_body: NCP chief Sharad Pawar on Saturday said that the work of the Metro service to be inaugurated by PM Narendra Modi in Pune on Sunday is incomplete. He made the comment on the eve of PM Modi's visit to Pune. Pawar also said that the Centre needs to focus more on rescuing Indian students stranded in war-hit Ukraine.

389.title: US, Germany, Netherlands to send more weapons, troops: Lithuania
389.article_body: Lithuanian Defence Minister Arvydas Anušauskas on Saturday said Germany, US and Netherlands will send air defence systems, battalion armed with tanks and troops to Lithuania respectively. This comes in addition to troops which will visit Lithuania for military exercises this month. Lithuania which shares borders with Belarus, Russia asked NATO for more troops after Russian invasion of Ukraine.

390.title: Italian region offers to pay couples ₹1.6 lakh if they get married there
390.article_body: Italy's Lazio region is offering a refund of up to €2,000 (around ₹1.6 lakh) to couples who choose to host their wedding there, authorities said. Lazio is a central Italian region with Rome as its principal city. Authorities have set aside €10 million for the 'Lazio with love' initiative under which Italian and foreign couples are entitled to refunds.

391.title: Airport worker trolls Russia by waving Ukrainian flag to signal plane in Israel
391.article_body: An Israeli airport worker was seen waving the Ukrainian flag towards a Russian plane at Tel Aviv Airport. In a now-viral video, the unidentified man clad in a high-visibility vest of a ground crew is seen waving Ukraine's blue and yellow flag to signal a plane with a Russian flag outside its cockpit. The worker has reportedly been suspended.

392.title: Salman Khan to showcase art in first-ever solo show in Bengaluru
392.article_body: Actor Salman Khan will be showcasing his artwork in his first-ever solo show in Bengaluru's gallery g. The show titled 'Motherhood - An Artistic Ode to Mother Teresa' will be on display from March 11 to 20. Two of Salman's paintings, titled 'Still In Hope of Compassion' and 'Begging for Peace', will be on display on the GAC digital platform.

393.title: China to bring incentives to cut pollution, carbon emissions: Govt
393.article_body: Chinese government on Saturday said it will introduce new incentives to cut pollution and carbon emissions this year. China would "work harder" for cleaner, more efficient use of coal, said Premier Li Keqiang. He added government will increase the capacity of grids for power absorption by renewable sources. China has pledged to become carbon neutral by around 2060.

394.title: Manish Sisodia inaugurates Delhi's first-of-its-kind teachers' university
394.article_body: Delhi Deputy CM Manish Sisodia has inaugurated the Delhi Teachers' University and said it's created to produce "nation builders". He said, "This is Delhi's first of its kind university that aims to prepare...highly qualified teachers. Government aims to inspire today's students to become tomorrow's teachers." It will offer a new age integrated teacher education programme like B.Ed after Class 12.

395.title: France plans to boost safety, security of Ukraine nuclear sites
395.article_body: French President Emmanuel Macron on Saturday said France will propose measures to boost safety, security of five main nuclear sites in Ukraine. The safeguards will be drawn up on the basis of International Atomic Energy Agency (IAEA) criteria, a statement by Macron added. This comes after a blaze broke out at Ukraine's Zaporizhzhia nuclear plant following Russian shelling on Friday.

396.title: Russian man smashes his iPad after Apple stops selling products in Russia, video viral
396.article_body: Footage shows a Russian man smashing his iPad after Apple decided to stop selling its products in Russia amid invasion of Ukraine. He uses a hammer to smash it, also getting his son to deliver a few blows. "Here's our response to American sanctions! We don't fear you! We'll live without your nice 'pretty' things!" the man said.

397.title: UN probes alleged massacre that left dozens dead in Mali
397.article_body: The UN on Friday said it's investigating allegations that dozens of people were massacred in Mali. A video circulating on social media since Thursday shows dozens of badly-burned bodies with their eyes blindfolded and their hands bound together, according to Reuters. The bodies were found in an area where Islamist militants have been battling Malian soldiers, a local official said.

398.title: India record their highest Test total in Mohali, Sri Lanka end Day 2 at 108/4
398.article_body: India recorded their highest Test total in Mohali by declaring at 574/8 in their first innings in first Test against Sri Lanka. The visitors ended the second day at 108/4 with Ravichandran Ashwin taking two wickets. Ravindra Jadeja scored an unbeaten 175 in the first innings, registering the highest-ever Test score by an Indian batting at number seven.

399.title: Satyagraha will prove an unconquerable force: Mahindra on protests in Ukraine
399.article_body: Mahindra Group's Chairman Anand Mahindra on Saturday tweeted a video of unarmed Ukrainians protesting against Russian troops in Kherson. Mahindra wrote, "When an army has to face unarmed civilians, they’re facing a weapon more powerful than tanks. Satyagraha will always prove an unconquerable force…Ask the British." In the clip, shots were also fired to disperse the crowd.

400.title: Inspired by YouTube video, 3 youngsters try to rob ATM kiosk in Delhi; held
400.article_body: Police arrested three people, including a 16-year-old juvenile for allegedly trying to rob an ATM kiosk inspired by a YouTube video in Outer Delhi's Nangloi area. The Axis Bank headquarters had informed police about some people carrying out suspicious activities at the kiosk on March 1. Police seized a drill machine, a hammer and a screw machine from their possession.

401.title: Govt panel recommends phase 3 trial of Sputnik Light COVID vaccine as booster dose
401.article_body: An expert panel of India's central drug authority has recommended the Drugs Controller General of India (DCGI) to give its nod for conducting phase-3 clinical trial of Sputnik Light as a booster dose. DCGI approved the single-dose COVID-19 vaccine for emergency use in India subject to regulatory provisions on February 4. Sputnik Light vaccine has been approved in 29 countries.

402.title: India looking for tech to build electric mass rapid transportation: Gadkari
402.article_body: Union Minister Nitin Gadkari said India is looking for a cost-effective technology to build mass rapid transportation system based on electricity. Addressing the Silicon Valley Dialogue, Gadkari added he has been approached by some American companies with the technology. Urging American companies to invest in India, he said both countries have a huge pool of young and talented engineers.

403.title: What are the major announcements made for B'luru in state Budget 2022-23?
403.article_body: Presenting the 2022-23 state Budget, Karnataka CM Basavaraj Bommai announced that ₹8,409 crore has been allocated for Bengaluru's development, including 1,000 crore for the Mekedatu project. He said that a skywalk will be constructed at Banashankari junction to connect the metro station with the bus stand. A mega jewellery park, 'Green Expo' and 'Namma Clinics' will be established in Bengaluru.

404.title: Will Smith, Michael B Jordan to star in and produce 'I Am Legend' sequel
404.article_body: Actors Will Smith and Michael B Jordan will star in and produce the sequel of 2007 film 'I Am Legend'. This will be the first time that the actors will work together. According to Deadline, Oscar-winning Akiva Goldsman, who adapted Richard Matheson's 1954 novel for the 2007 film, will return to pen and produce the sequel.
